text: Kovdor () is a town and the administrative center of Kovdorsky District of Murmansk Oblast, Russia, mostly known for its mining industry. Population: ==History== By 1965, Kovdor was work settlement in the suburban area of the town of Kirovsk.Administrative-Territorial Division of Murmansk Oblast, p. 57 By the September 20, 1965 Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the Russian SFSR Decree, it was granted the status of a town under district jurisdiction and subordinated to Kirovsk Town Soviet. However, by the June 28, 1967 Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the RSFSR Decree, Kovdor was subordinated to Apatity—a town under oblast jurisdiction which was granted this status a year before. ==Economy== Lenina Street. A view to the chimney of Kovdorsky GOK Kovdor is located in the center of a large mineral resources field. The town's industry is mostly tied to mining. A carbonatite mine is located near the town. Public limited company "Kovdor's Mining Plant" (Kovdorsky gorno- obogatitelny kombinat, or Kovdorsky GOK) is the largest company in the town and in Kovdorsky District. Kovdorsky GOK is a part of Russia's largest mineral fertilizer producer EuroChem. The area around Kovdor is rich in mica, iron ore, and vermiculite. The town named after Kovdoro lake.Information about Kovdorsky District and Kovdorsky GOK ==International relations== ===Twin towns and sister cities=== Kovdor is twinned with: * Haparanda, Sweden * Salla, Finland ==References== ==External links== *Unofficial site of Kovdor *Map of Kovdor * *Kovdor-OnLine!
